clinical_study.brief_title: Time-restricted Eating and High Intensity Interval Training Among Women
clinical_study.official_title: Isolated and Combined Effects of High Intensity Interval Training and Time Restricted Eating on Glycaemic Control in Reproductive-aged Women With Overweight or Obesity

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: This project will determine the independent and combined effects of high intensity interval training and time-restricted eating on blood sugar regulation among women in reproductive-age who have overweight or obesity. The intervention period will be seven weeks. Before and after the intervention, blood sugar regulation, body composition and physical fitness will be measured and compared between groups who are doing either high intensity interval training, time-restricted eating, both high intensity interval training and time-restricted eating, or who are in a control group. Physical activity, sleep quality, continuous glucose monitoring, adherence to the interventions and hunger/satiety will also be measured.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to after 7 weeks intervention
primary_outcome.description: Total area under the plasma glucose curve over two hours after a 75 g oral glucose tolerance test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to after 7 weeks intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Insulin sensitivity estimated by homeostatic model assessment for insulin resistance (fasting serum insulin concentration (Î¼U/mL) x fasting plasma glucose levels (mmol/L)/22.5)

secondary_outcome.measure: Insulin levels after ingestion of glucose

secondary_outcome.description: Total area under the serum insulin two hours after a 75 g oral glucose tolerance test

other_outcome.measure: Adherence to high intensity interval training
other_outcome.description: Number of completed exercise sessions out of those prescribed, in percentage

other_outcome.measure: Compliance to high intensity interval training
other_outcome.description: Exercise intensity, heart rate in percentage of individual heart rate maximum
Average daily eating window, in hours
Average number of days where per week that daily eating window is 10 hours or less.

other_outcome.time_frame: 14 days at baseline (one week of habitual diet and one week after the intervention starts)
The last 14 days of the intervention

arm_group.description: High intensity interval training for seven weeks. Three weekly, supervised training sessions.
Time-restricted eating for seven weeks. Maximal daily eating window of 10 hours.

arm_group.arm_group_label: High Intensity Interval Training & Time-Restricted Eating

arm_group.description: Will be given information about the recommended level of physical activity for health benefits and a healthy diet.

intervention.description: Three weekly, supervised exercise sessions with high intensity. Each session will last for 30-45 minutes. Intervention period will be seven weeks.
intervention.arm_group_label: High Intensity Interval Training & Time-Restricted Eating

intervention.description: Restricted daily window of caloric intake to maximum 10 hours. Intervention period will be seven weeks.
intervention.arm_group_label: High Intensity Interval Training & Time-Restricted Eating

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- body mass index â¥ 27 kg/cm2,
- able to walk on a treadmill or ride a bike for at least 60 min.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy, lactation within 24 weeks of study commencement
- known cardiovascular disease
- type 1 or 2 diabetes
- currently taking hypertension or glucose- or lipid-lowering medication
- habitual eating window < 12 hours
- performing high intensity training more than once a week
- body mass variations > 4 kg three months prior to study commencement
- shift work that includes night shifts.
